thread.title: Donald Trump's St Patrick's Day Make America Great Again hat has a really embarrassing mistake on it
thread.title_full: Donald Trump's St Patrick's Day Make America Great Again hat has a really embarrassing mistake on it

author: Jo-Anne Rowney
title: Donald Trump's St Patrick's Day Make America Great Again hat has a really embarrassing mistake on it

organizations.name: st patrick's day make america great again

text:
Donald Trump's St Patrick's Day Make America Great Again hat has a really embarrassing mistake on it "Make America Smart Again" Donald Trump wears his Make America Great Again hat (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Share Get politics   Thank you for subscribing!   
It's not long until St Patrick's Day so it's no surprise Trump decided to mix it up and change his famous Make America Great Again hat. 
The hats, which became an emblem for Trump's campaign, are on sale for a mere $50 to mark St Patrick's Day. 
In homage to his Irish heritage the President of the United States switched the red and white for green. 
But that wasn't all he did. The Make America Great Again is now in gold emblazoned across the front and there's a shamrock on the back of them. 
So far, so good. 
Or not. Trump's hats have quite a glaring mistake - that isn't a shamrock. 
This is a four-leafed clover. 
A shamrock is the real symbol of Ireland and has three leaves. Of course, people spotted it straight away... It was fairly obvious... The whole of Ireland collectively sighs... There's even a shirt for it. 
To recap, for those at the back of the class.... This is a shamrock ...this is a shamrock (Photo: EyeEm) This is a four-leaf clover... ...four leaf clover (take a look Trump) (Photo: Science Photo Library RM) 
Now where's that facepalm emoji. Like us on Facebook
